page.title: 12COMMUTING FROM PADBURY
page.content: The population of Padbury is a little over 600, that of Hillesden only about 300. Some people are self-employed within the villages on farms, in shops and public houses,but with very few exceptions the majority of the workforce have to travel,sometimes considerable distances,to work. Some travel to the brickworks (soon to be closed) 5 miles away. Some travel to the nearest town, Buckingham, which is 3 miles away. The majority, however, travel 15 miles either to Aylesbury or the new city of Milton Keynes. There are several people who commute to London daily, either on the train from Milton Keynes or driving the 50 miles each way. There are others who have homes in London and commute weekly to second homes in Padbury or Hillesden. The result to the village is numerous cars and a quiet middle of the day.
